title: Should Investors Buy the Dip in Alphabet or Microsoft Stock After Earnings?
text: Over the last year, Alphabet and Microsoft's stock have soared +41% and +60% respectively and investors may be wondering if today's selloff is a buying opportunity.

title: Listen to Wall Street and Buy These 3 Stocks Now
text: To be blunt, buying a Wall Street recommended stock can be a mixed bag. While we trust experts in say the legal and medical fields, it's a different proposition in the equities space.

title: AMD Q4 Earnings In Line, Top Line Aided by Solid Client Growth
text: AMD's fourth-quarter 2023 results reflect robust Client and Data Center revenues that offset weakness in the Gaming and Embedded segments.

title: Microsoft Posts 17.6% Revenue Growth, Issues Blah Guidance, Stock Edges Down
text: Microsoft disappointed investors with its latest financial report. While revenues were stronger than expected, the software giant's forecast for the current quarter fell short of Wall Street expectations.

title: Microsoft And Google Cloud Growth Impressed. Can Amazon Follow?
text: Analysts say Microsoft's and Google's cloud results are a positive sign for Amazon Web Services' fourth-quarter sales.

title: Microsoft earnings a 'masterpiece' to adorn the Louvre, says analyst
text: The Microsoft Corp (NASDAQ:MSFT) quarterly earnings published overnight and guidance from chief executive officer Satya Nadella were described by Wedbush analyst Dan Ives as a "masterpiece quarter/guidance and conference call that should be printed out and hung in the Louvre". Having risen to an all-time high last week, the shares fell on Wednesday despite the Redmond, California company reporting strong fiscal second-quarter performance from its Cloud division helping quarterly revenue and earnings beat Wall Street expectations.

title: The 7 Best Blue-Chip Stocks to Invest In for Big Gains in 2024
text: While technology stocks continue to drive the market higher, they are not the only game in town. Investors needn't invest only in semiconductor stocks to achieve big gains.

title: Private-Sector Payrolls Declined More Than Expected
text: January Jobs Week continues this morning, even as we're only just closing out the month today. Private-sector payrolls reported by Automatic Data Processing ( ADP ) came in below estimates: 107K versus 150K expected, and beneath the previous month's downwardly revised 158K.

title: The AI Renaissance: Insights from 3 AI Juggernauts
text: Examining insights from top AI players, Super Micro Computer, Advanced Micro Devices, and Microsoft tells us that the AI revolution is alive and well.

title: ADP Cools to 107K Private-Sector Jobs; BA, NVO Beat in Q4
text: We've now spent a full six months sub-200K private-sector job gains per month.

title: Microsoft (MSFT) Q2 Earnings & Revenues Beat on Cloud Strength
text: Microsoft's (MSFT) second-quarter fiscal 2024 results reflect strength in the Azure business and Office 365, boosted by growing AI business.

title: AI Drives Microsoft's Q2 Earnings: Top ETF Picks
text: Microsoft (MSFT) posted the highest profit growth in more than two years and the strongest revenue growth since 2022.

title: Microsoft Is Already the World's Largest Company. Here's Why That's Unlikely to Change Anytime Soon.
text: Microsoft generated $62 billion in revenue in its most recent quarter (the three months ending Dec. 31), up 18% year over year. The company saw stellar growth from its cloud services business.

title: Will Nvidia Be Worth More Than Microsoft by 2030?
text: Microsoft's AI business has gained solid traction, but Nvidia is doing better on this front. Nvidia's market cap could keep growing faster than Microsoft's, given the incredible pace at which its earnings are expected to increase compared to Microsoft.

title: Morgan Stanley raises Microsoft, Google stock price targets after earnings
text: Microsoft Corp (NASDAQ: MSFT) and Alphabet Inc (NASDAQ: GOOGL) have sharply rallied in the trailing twelve months but a Morgan Stanley analyst is convinced both still have significant room to the upside.

title: Microsoft earnings may have offered a big bullish clue about cloud growth
text: Forget Microsoft Corp.'s expectation for Azure revenue growth this quarter that is similar to what was seen last quarter. There may have been a far more bullish hint in the company's latest commentary about what to expect from the cloud business.

title: Yes, Microsoft Is a Star AI Stock, But This Is What Really Powered Its Solid Second-Quarter Results
text: One part of its collection of products and services saw its revenue rise by 30%. This helped drive the tech giant's overall top line nearly 20% higher.

title: Microsoft stock to $450? Here's How
text: Microsoft's NASDAQ: MSFT share price is driven by its growing position in the cloud. Late to the game, Microsoft has leaned hard into cloud and cloud services and AI, gaining share from Amazon Web Services, Google, Alibaba and others.

title: 2 upgraded food stocks with super-sized gain potential
text: Signs of a soft economic landing and hopes for an aggressive Fed rate cut campaign have helped the S&P 500 finish higher in 12 of the last 13 weeks. Come Friday's closing bell, will it be 13 of 14?

title: Wall Street sets Microsoft stock price for the next 12 months
text: It would hardly be a stretch to say that the technology giant Microsoft (NASDAQ: MSFT) has recently been on a roll. Throughout 2022, the company's early investment in OpenAI and its platforms – including the flagship large language model (LLM), ChatGPT – paid off massively.

title: Humanoid robot startup Figure AI in funding talks with Microsoft, OpenAI
text: Figure AI Inc., a startup developing humanlike robots, is in talks to raise as much as $500 million in a funding round led by Microsoft Corp. and OpenAI, according to a person with knowledge of the matter.

title: Move Over, Apple -- Microsoft Is the New Largest Company in the World
text: Microsoft's AI investments are driving a lot of investors to the stock. Apple's business hasn't performed well over the past year.

title: Microsoft Has Three Trillion Reasons to Keep the Heat on Google
text: The software titan's value has set expectations high, but the latest results show clear momentum.

title: Investors punish Microsoft, Alphabet as AI returns fall short of lofty expectations
text: Tech giants on Tuesday talked up how customers are lapping up their generative AI-powered products, but mounting costs of developing the cutting-edge features irked investors hoping for a big boost to sales from the new technology.

title: Wall Street Analysts Love Microsoft's ‘Masterpiece' Results. Why the Stock Market Doesn't.
text: Microsoft stock is falling after the tech giant reports fiscal second-quarter earnings. Expectations were just so high.
